newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rupiah little changed, data ignored.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rupiah little changed, data ignored.

text.p: The Indonesian rupiah was little changed in late trading on Wednesday as the release of the country's latest economic data was largely ignored, dealers said.
"The announcement of the latest economic indicators failed to have much impact as the figures had been expected," one United States bank dealer said.
Indonesia announced that the consumer price index (CPI) rose 0.27 percent month-on-month in August compared to 0.68 percent in July and 0.32 percent in August 1995.
The government also announced that the trade surplus in the first six months of 1996 rose to $2.29 billion from $2.00 billion in January-June 1995.
The country posted a trade surplus of $193.4 million in June this year against a surplus of $203.1 million in May.
Spot rupiah was last at 2,344.40/44.60, compared with an opening of 2,343.50/44.50.
The dealer said the dollar-rupiah rate was likely to be between 2,344.50 and 2,345.00 on Thursday.
Today and tomorrow was last at 2,343.25/2,343.70 and 2,344.00/44.50 respectively.
One-month swap was at 17.25/17.75, two at 34.00/35.00, three at 52.50/52.75 and six at 104.00/105.00 points.
Dealers said news reports of a second missile attack on Iraq by the United States on Wednesday did not have much impact on the market.
The central bank set its intervention rate at 2,342/2,460 and the conversion rate at 2,342/2,388 on Wednesday.
